\pndec\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang {\pntxtb (}{\pntxta )}}{\*\pnseclvl6\pnlcltr\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang {\pntxtb (}{\pntxta )}}{\*\pnseclvl7\pnlcrm\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang {\pntxtb (}{\pntxta )}}{\*\pnseclvl8\pnlcltr\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang 

{\pntxtb (}{\pntxta )}}{\*\pnseclvl9\pnlcrm\pnstart1\pnindent720\pnhang {\pntxtb (}{\pntxta )}}\pard\plain \ltrpar\ql \li0\ri0\widctlpar\wrapdefault\aspalpha\aspnum\faauto\adjustright\rin0\lin0\itap0 \rtlch\fcs1 \af0\afs24\alang1025 \ltrch\fcs

0 

\fs24\lang1033\langfe1033\cgrid\langnp1033\langfenp1033 {\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \b\insrsid3477410\charrsid15210002 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \b\insrsid12979435\charrsid15210002 

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid3477410 

\par The }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid15210002 {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname address}}{\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname Street}}Kent County Levy Court{\*\xmlclose}{\*\xmlclose}

 has set a safety policy that requires the facility to meet or exceed any OSHA standard.  The Kent County Regional Wastewater Treatment Facility (KCRWTF) is certified to

 ISO 14001, and OHSAS 18001.  As a part of this certification, senior KCRWTF management is committed to reducing the environmental, health and safety impacts of its operations.  A long term goal of the program is to eliminate the use of both gaseous chlor

ine and sulfur dioxide.  The program also establishes a short term goal of protecting the employee and public health and safety.  This is accomplished by organizing, equipping and training }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid5668068 

a select team of employees to respond to any incidents involving releases of chlorine or sulfur dioxide, and to installing monitoring, preventive and mitigation processes to prevent or reduce any releases.}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid3477410 



\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid5668068 

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \b\insrsid5668068\charrsid5668068 {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname place}}{\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceName}}Kent{\*\xmlclose} {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceName}}County{\*\xmlclose}{\*\xmlclose}

 Regional Wastewater Treatment Facility and the regulated substances handled}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid5668068 .

\par 

\par The KCRWTF is a secondary wastewater treatment facility that handles the majority of wastewater generated within {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname

PlaceName}}Kent{\*\xmlclose} {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceName}}County{\*\xmlclose}

 and some wastewater from areas in {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname City}}New Castle{\*\xmlclose} and {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceName}}Sussex{\*\xmlclose} {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceType}}Counties{\*\xmlclose} that border 

{\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname place}}{\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceName}}Kent{\*\xmlclose} {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceName}}County{\*\xmlclose}{\*\xmlclose}.  The facility uses fine bubble aeration to initially treat the waste

water followed by clarification.  The treated wastewater is then chlorinated to reduce pathogens and dechlorinated to remove residual chlorine.  The regulated substances that are handled on site are gaseous chlorine stored in }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 

\ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 up to eight (8) one-}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid5668068 ton cylinders as a liquid under pressure and s}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 ulfur dioxide stored in up to 6 (6) one-ton}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 

\ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid5668068  cylinders }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 as a liquid under pressure.}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid5668068 

\par 

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \b\insrsid8067553\charrsid8067553 General Accidental Release Prevention Program

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553 

\par The KCRWTF has established detailed procedure for both the chlorine and sulfur dioxide systems.  There are alarms and other engineering controls on both systems}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid14039972 

 to prevent releases of the regulated substances}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553 .  }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid14039972 Additional monitoring systems have been added to the operations.  }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 

\insrsid8067553 Operators inspect both systems once every two hours}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid14039972  l

ooking for leaks and ensuring that they are both operating properly.  Detailed standard operating procedures (SOP\rquote 

s) that meet the ISO 1001 and OHSAS 18001 requirements have been implemented and all operators are trained on these SOP\rquote s.   Additional training has been prov

ided to operators and local responders.  The operators have been trained on how the control systems operate, what constitutes an emergency and how to respond to any emergency.  Local responders have been trained on the expected hazards and how the control

 systems operate.  The facility\rquote s SCADA system monitors the system operations and alarms when unusual conditions occur.  The SCADA system is monitored by plant personnel 24 hours a day.}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553 

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \b\insrsid6495885\charrsid6495885 Five Year Accident History

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 

\par There have been no major incidents involving the regulated hazards over the past twenty years.}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid15624625 

  A small release of chlorine (less than 100 pounds) occurred on July 31, 2006 which resulted in a major review of current SOP\rquote s and operating systems with minor equipment and procedural changes occurring

 as a result.  The release was confined to the immediate area of the system and did not pose a risk to the general public.}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 

\par 

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \b\insrsid6495885\charrsid6495885 The Emergency Response Program

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 

\par In the event of an emergency involving any of the regulated hazards, the local 911 center will be ca

lled.  A plant response team will be dressed out as required by the hazard and seek to respond to the incident and try to correct the problem.  Senior management at the facility will be mobilized as the

control team.  The local volunteer fire departments 

will immediately be dispatched.  The Delaware Emergency Management Agency (DEMA) will be notified and DNREC and other agencies will respond to provide appropriate support.  {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname place}}{\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceName}}

Kent{\*\xmlclose} {\*\xmlopen\xmlns2{\factoidname PlaceName}}County{\*\xmlclose}{\*\xmlclose} will also mobilize its emergency response unit.  The }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553 response team is cu

rrently under going retraining, additional personal protective equipment have been ordered and a table top exercise involving the team is expected to be to conducted shortly with a full response exercise scheduled for Spring 2007.}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 

\ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 

\par 

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \b\insrsid6495885\charrsid6495885 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 

\par The KCRWTF will unde}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553 r its Environmental Health and S}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 afety }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553 M}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 

anagement}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553  S}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 ystem (EHS-MS), seek to find alternatives to }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553 

the use of pure chlorine and sulfur dioxide.  The facility will evaluate the use of ultraviolet (UV) disinfection and intends to use it for an expansion.  The facility will also seek to replace the chlorine with }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 

\insrsid15624625 either liquid sodium hydroxide or}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid8067553  solid calcium chloride.}{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid6495885 

\par }{\rtlch\fcs1 \af0 \ltrch\fcs0 \insrsid15624625 

\par }}
